'''Fluxbuntu''' is an unofficial, lightweight [[Linux distribution]] which uses [[Fluxbox]] [[window manager]] and is based on [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]]. By contrast, Ubuntu uses the [[GNOME]] desktop environment, [[Kubuntu]] uses [[KDE]], and [[Xubuntu]] uses [[Xfce]], all of which are somewhat more demanding of computer memory and resources. Fluxbuntu is designed to be both minimalist and full featured.
+
'''Fluxbuntu''' is an unofficial, lightweight [[Linux distribution]] which uses [[Fluxbox]] [[window manager]] and is based on [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]]. By contrast, Ubuntu uses the [[GNOME]] desktop environment, [[Kubuntu]] uses [[KDE]], and [[Xubuntu]] uses [[Xfce]], all of which are somewhat more demanding of computer memory and resources. Fluxbuntu is designed to be both minimalist and full featured.
